analyzed: na punar śaptam ātmānam smarāmi
translated: But I do not remember cursing myself.

original: athavā prāpto mayā sa hi śāpo virahaśūnyahṛdayayā na viditaḥ /
analyzed: athavā prāptaḥ mayā sa hi śāpaḥ viraha śūnya hṛdayayā na viditaḥ
translated: Or rather, that curse was obtained by me, unknown to me, with my heart empty of separation.

original: ataḥ sakhībhyāṃ saṃdiṣṭāsmi bhartur aṅgulīyakaṃ darśayitavyam iti /
analyzed: atas sakhībhyām saṃdiṣṭā asmi bhartuḥ aṅgulīyakam darśayitavyam iti
translated: Therefore, I have been instructed by my friends to show my husband's ring.

analyzed: mārīca vatse caritārthā asi
translated: Maricha Child, you have fulfilled your purpose.

original: tad idānīṃ sahadharmacāriṇaṃ prati na tvayā manyuḥ kāryaḥ / paśya /
analyzed: tat idānīm saha dharmacāriṇam prati na tvayā manyuḥ kāryaḥ paśya
translated: So now you should not be angry with your co-wife. See.

original: śāpād asi pratihatā smṛtirodharūkṣe bhartary apetatamasi prabhutā tava eva /
analyzed: śāpāt asi pratihatā smṛti rodha rūkṣe bhartari apeta tamasi prabhu tā tava eva
translated: By the curse, you are obstructed, your memory roughened by obstruction, your husband is devoid of true knowledge, your authority is indeed over him.

original: chāyā na mūrchati malopahataprasāde śuddhe tu darpaṇatale sulabhāvakāśā // / //p /
analyzed: chāyā na mūrchati mala upahata prasāde śuddhe tu darpaṇa tale sulabha avakāśā
translated: A shadow does not appear on a mirror-surface defiled by dirt, but is easily accommodated on a pure surface.

analyzed: rājā yathā āha bhagavān
translated: The king as he said, Blessed One.

original: mārīca vatsa kaccid abhinanditas tvayā vidhivad asmābhir anuṣṭhitajātakarmā putra eṣa śākuntaleyaḥ /
analyzed: mārīca vatsa kaccit abhinanditaḥ tvayā vidhivat asmābhiḥ anuṣṭhita jāta karmā putraḥ eṣa śākuntaleyaḥ
translated: Maricha Child, surely this son of Shakuntala, for whom the birth rites have been duly performed by us, is accepted by you?

original: rājā bhagavann atra khalu me vaṃśapratiṣṭhā /
analyzed: rājā bhagavan atra khalu me vaṃśa pratiṣṭhā
translated: King Blessed One, indeed, this is the establishment of my lineage.

analyzed: iti bālam hastena gṛhṇāti
translated: He takes the child by the hand.

original: mārīca tathābhāvinam enaṃ cakravartinam avagacchatu bhavān / paśya /
analyzed: mārīca tathābhāvinam enam cakravartinam avagacchatu bhavān paśya
translated: And, Maricha, you must recognize this future emperor. Look:

analyzed: rathena an uddhāta stimita gatinā tīrṇa jaladhiḥ
translated: By a chariot that moves with an undaunted, steady pace, he has crossed the ocean

analyzed: purā sapta dvīpām jayati vasudhām apratirathaḥ
translated: and now conquers the earth with its seven continents, invincible.

analyzed: iha ayam sattvānām prasabha damanāt sarva damanaḥ
translated: Here he is called Sarvadamana because he forcibly subdues beings,

original: punar yāsyaty ākhyāṃ bharata il lokasya bharaṇāt // / //
analyzed: punar yāsyati ākhyām bharataḥ id lokasya bharaṇāt
translated: and he will again be known as Bharata because he supports the people.

original: rājā bhagavatā kṛtasaṃskāre sarvam asmin vayam āśāsmahe /
analyzed: rājā bhagavatā kṛta saṃskāre sarvam asmin vayam āśāsmahe
translated: Now that the Blessed One has performed the consecration ceremony for him, we all hope that he will rule over this entire world.

original: aditi bhagavann asyā duhitṛmanorathasaṃpatteḥ kaṇvo 'pi tāvatśrutavistāraḥ kriyatām /
analyzed: aditi bhagavan asyāḥ duhitṛ manoratha saṃpatteḥ kaṇvaḥ pi tāvat śruta vistāraḥ kriyatām
translated: O Blessed One, since the fulfillment of the wish of his daughter is at hand, let Kanva also be informed of this.

analyzed: duhitṛ vatsalā menakā iha eva upacarantī tiṣṭhati
translated: Menaka, who is devoted to her daughter, is staying here itself, serving.

analyzed: śakuntalā ātma gatam
translated: Shakuntala, to herself

analyzed: manorathaḥ khalu me bhaṇitaḥ bhagavatyā
translated: The Blessed One has indeed spoken my wish.

original: mārīca tapaḥprabhavāt pratyakṣaṃ sarvam eva tatrabhavataḥ /
analyzed: mārīca tapaḥ prabhavāt pratyakṣam sarvam eva tatrabhavataḥ
translated: Maricha, everything there is directly perceived by him, who has attained power through austerities.

original: rājā ataḥ khalu mama nātikruddho muniḥ /
analyzed: rājā atas khalu mama na ati kruddhaḥ muniḥ
translated: King, therefore the sage is not very angry with me.

original: mārīca tathāpy asau priyam asmābhiḥ praṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: mārīca tathā api asau priyam asmābhiḥ praṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Maricha, nevertheless, we must ask him something agreeable.

analyzed: kaḥ kaḥ tra bhoḥ praviśya
translated: Who is there, gentlemen? Enter

analyzed: śiṣya bhagavan ayam asmi
translated: Disciple, I am here, my lord.

original: mārīca gālava idānīm eva vihāyasā gatvā mama vacanāt tatrabhavate
analyzed: mārīca gālavaḥ idānīm eva vihāyasā gatvā mama vacanāt tatrabhavate
translated: Maricha, Galava, having gone through the air right now, tell that revered Kanva on my behalf

original: kaṇvāya priyam āvedaya yathā putravatī śakuntalā tatśāpanivṛttau smṛtimatā duṣyantena pratigṛhīteti /
analyzed: kaṇvāya priyam āvedaya yathā putravatī śakuntalā tad śāpa nivṛttau smṛtimatā duṣyantena pratigṛhītā iti
translated: that Shakūntala, having a son, has been accepted by Dushyānta, who remembers her, in order to end the curse.

original: śiṣyaḥ yad ājñāpayati bhagavān iti niṣkrāntaḥ
analyzed: śiṣyaḥ yat ājñāpayati bhagavān iti niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: Disciple: As the revered one commands. He exits.

original: mārīca vatsa tvam api svāpatyadārasahitaḥ sakyur ākhaṇḍalasya ratham āruhya te rājadhānīṃ pratiṣṭhasva /
analyzed: mārīca vatsa tvam api sva apatya dāra sahitaḥ sakyuḥ ākhaṇḍalasya ratham āruhya te rājadhānīm pratiṣṭhasva
translated: Maricha: My child, you too, together with your wife and son, should ascend Indra's chariot and return to your capital.

analyzed: rājā yat ājñāpayati bhagavān
translated: King: As the revered one commands.

analyzed: mārīca api ca
translated: Maricha: And furthermore.

analyzed: tava bhavatu viṣ ojāḥ prājya vṛṣṭiḥ prajāsu
translated: Let there be a rain of plenty from the clouds for the people.

analyzed: tvam api vitata yajñaḥ vajriṇam prīṇayasva
translated: You too, with your extensive sacrifices, please Indra.

analyzed: yuga śata parivartān evam anyonya kṛtyaiḥ
translated: Thus, for a hundred ages, you two

analyzed: nayatam ubhaya loka anugraha ślāghanīyaiḥ
translated: should lead your lives, worthy of praise for your mutual duties and for your kindness to both worlds.

analyzed: rājā bhagavan yathāśakti śreyase yatiṣye
translated: King: My lord, I will strive for my welfare to the best of my ability.

original: mārīca vatsa kiṃ te bhūyaḥ priyam upakaromi /
analyzed: mārīca vatsa kim te bhūyas priyam upakaromi
translated: Maricha: My child, what further service can I do for you?

original: rāja ataḥ param api priyam asti /
analyzed: rāja ataḥ param api priyam asti
translated: King: There is another service after this.

original: yadīha bhagavān priyaṃ kartum icchati tarhi idam astu /
analyzed: yadi iha bhagavān priyam kartum icchati tarhi idam astu
translated: If the Blessed One wishes to do what is pleasing, then let this be:

analyzed: pravartatām prakṛti hitāya pārthivaḥ
translated: May the king proceed for the welfare of the people.

original: sarasvatī śrutamahatāṃ mahīyatām /🔽mama api ca kṣapayatu nīlalohitaḥ
analyzed: sarasvatī śruta mahatām mahīyatām  mama api ca kṣapayatu nīlalohitaḥ
translated: May Sarasvatī, the great goddess of learning, be honored by the learned.🔽And may Nīlalohita, the self-existent one whose power has reached the end of rebirth,

analyzed: punarbhavam parigata śaktiḥ ātmabhūḥ
translated: destroy my rebirth.

analyzed: niṣkrāntāḥ sarve
translated: All exit.

analyzed: iti saptamaḥ ṅkaḥ
translated: Thus ends the seventh act.

analyzed: samāptam idam abhijñānaśākuntalam nāma nāṭakam
translated: This play called The Recognition of Shakūntala is complete.
